pullRequest.title: Support metadata DELETE in JDBC connectors
pullRequest.bodyText:
Support metadata DELETE in JDBC connectors
Fixes #5275

nodes.bodyText: What is additionalPredicate? Is it somehow connected with limit? If not, why don't you need it in delete?
Seems like magic constant. Is it used somewhere? Maybe tests are needed?
Can it be not null when beginDelete throws an exception?

if supportsDelete=true why this test never assertQuerySucceeds("DELETE FROM "?
Could you please add such scenario? The same is for other connectors.

Yeah, I meant exactly that place (I started this discussion here because there is no additionalPredicate in code you added for DELETE).
Let me please clarify my comment.
Imagine situation when you have some data (key_column, year, name) in table A.
And there are 2 splits: key_column % 2 = 0 and other when key_column % 2 = 1.
Usually user executes selects on A: select name from A where year = <year> which translates to two with splits:
select name from A where key_column % 2 = 0 and year = <year>
select name from A where key_column % 2 = 1 and year = <year>

To optimize these queries downstream system has CREATE INDEX a_idx ON a (key_column, year)
If you don't propagate additionalPredicate to DELETE this could end up with a_idx is not used for DELETE.
Could you please check if such scenario is covered?
int executeUpdate -> int updatedCount or something
This looks like common code which could be unified. Thoughts?
It does (for ORC ACID tables)
revert
The only difference is the commit is missing. Why?
The only difference is the commit is missing. Why?

Why?

add a test with an equality condition on a bigint column -- should work
add a test with a range condition on a bigint column -- should work
add a test with an equality condition on a varchar column -- should not work, since filter is not fully removed on Presto side
Why is this overridden?
Why this is overridden? Also, this is overridden twice for oracle
unused?

I am not getting this. If row-by-row is not supported for any of the connectors, then i do not understand why io.prestosql.plugin.jdbc.QueryBuilder#buildDeleteSql does tuple domain -> WHERE conversion
skip exception

testDeleteWithSimplePredicate -> testDeleteWithBigintEquality
+ add a test for varchar equality. Ideally one that would show incorrect query results when the condition is applied case insensitively.
skip exception
skip exception
skip exception
make sure the table handle does not have any unexpected attributes, like grouping sets or synthetic columns.
It is used, see the comment above.
I thought that I have already unified this by extracting applyParameters method. Do you have any idea what else could be done here?
This is copied from testDelete() from above.
beginDelete is not called if this can be done by metadata delete (applyDelete)

I added io.trino.testing.AbstractTestDistributedQueries#testDeleteWithSimplePredicate that is executed for mysql and covers very simple predicate pushdown.
Notice that I added here predicate with random. I don't want to hardcode what is supported and what extend. Delete is supported if predicate pushdown is supported. Predicate pushdown support is changing over time, so such test would need to be updated frequently.

It will have to be overriden for all JDBC connectors, test testDelete requires delete row by row which JDBC connector won't have for a while.
Maybe I could add supportsRowByRowDelete()? (I don't like it)
It was falling that one cannot call commit when autocommit=true. Now I set autocommit explicitly so I can remove explicit commit.

tuple domain is not used to delete row-by-row, by rather to remove by predicate. By row-by-row I mean to delete query execution in Trino where we collect ids of rows to be deleted and then we remove them (beginDelete and finishDelete methods).
isn't it default for JDBC?
DeleteEntireTable -> DeleteAllRows

Can this test set up an ACID table?
i guess file metastore is not supported for ACID, right? cc @djsstarburst

PostgreSql -> PostgreSQL
but, why is that? didn't you add support for it?
SqlServer -> SQL Server
Mysql -> MySQL
i'd expect varchar-based delete to be special, since MySQL connector doesn't enforce varchar predicates (case sensitiviness). Why is it not special?
This method is not needed, since base class method ConnectorMetadata.beginDelete() raises the same exception.
is this comment still actual? If yes, it's hard to find where it belongs.
static import
consider static import
Is this branch dead?
why is this invalidation needed?
I guess we might need to drop only the metadata/statistics if it exists. Other cache related to table meta need not be invalidated.
Can we add a check before casting it to JdbcNamedRelationHandle ?
Can we extract it for both SELECT and DELETE ?

Sorry, this method got renamed when support for SQL UPDATE was merged.  The new name of the method you were thinking of is getDeleteRowIdColumnHandle(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorTableHandle tableHandle).
However, for metadata delete, I don't believe either method will ever be called, so I think it can/should be omitted until row-by-row DELETE is supported in the JDBC connector.
We invalidate table statistics with this.
I use it to raise different error message.
will it return null if try fails?
please make this statement the first one in the method.
why is this dependency needed?

nodes.bodyText:
Why no SUPPORTS_DELETE, SUPPORTS_CREATE_VIEW as in BaseJdbcConnectorTest?
Does it indicate haps in the smoke test?
Don't skip the test. Instead, add proper conditions to the test (based on the declared hasBehavior)
is it related?
Document why
Document why

Sadly, this is a wrong name. It's hive-ism. "metadata delete" doesn't make any sense for JDBC connectors and that's not what implemented.
What we're looking for here is "delete delegation" (or "delete 'pushdown'", but i think delegation is a better term).
(Fortunately, there is nothing in testing connector behavior that requires us to reuse naming from SPI, and we already leverage that.)

hasBehavior should allow us to drive the reusable test without need to split it up.

nodes.bodyText:
I cannot, as the other method is using SchemaTableName and this is using JdbcTableHandle.
Using always version with SchemaTableName is suboptimal when data change event does not affect entire table.
I think that onDataChanged is too ambitious. It does not fit well with parameter JdbcTableHandle as it does not invalidate data for entire table like one could expect when data is changed. Unless "data" term also refers to "metadata"? I think the easiest is to rename it is to invalidateTableStatistics and do not pretend it is anything more than that.
WDYT?
This was written in a way you want. And it was failing for certain connectors. Now I don't remember the exact problem. Will do it suggested way and try to capture differences in connectors.
This is a bit pointless as DELETE does not support LIMIT.
Thanks.
The question should be: Why SUPPORTS_DELETE, SUPPORTS_CREATE_VIEW is in BaseJdbcConnectorTest given that it is set to defaults?
specify actual expected rows.
i think this method is not necessary -- at least not in this PR, since the only two usages should be better served with returnsEmptyResult and exact result check respectively.

it does not, but this code should not require understanding SQL to reason about it's correctness.
It takes a JdbcTableHandle so it should validate JdbcTableHandle shape

Some connector might have partial support for DELETE statement.

@kokosing In case of connectors where the test infra is shared this can lead to test data being deleted.
Or is the assumption that if the hasBehavior is implemented correctly it shouldn't matter since the actual test performs deletions against copies of tables?
